content.raw:
how do you feel modifying the example world so one of the reference poses is expressed in the default world frame?

~~~
diff -r 9c892494f41c worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world
--- a/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Mon Feb 26 16:29:27 2018 -0800
+++ b/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Wed Feb 28 10:41:10 2018 -0800
@@ -105,7 +105,7 @@
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_1" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
       <namespace>gazebo/default/drill/alignment_1/</namespace>
       <pose frame="drill::link">-0.004 0.135 0.239 0 -0.1 1.570796</pose>
-      <pose frame="Mailbox::link">.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
+      <pose>1.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
       <enable>true</enable>
     </plugin>
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_2" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
~~~
content.html:
how do you feel modifying the example world so one of the reference poses is expressed in the default world frame?

diff -r 9c892494f41c worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world
--- a/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Mon Feb 26 16:29:27 2018 -0800
+++ b/worlds/misalignment_plugin_demo.world     Wed Feb 28 10:41:10 2018 -0800
@@ -105,7 +105,7 @@
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_1" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
       <namespace>gazebo/default/drill/alignment_1/</namespace>
       <pose frame="drill::link">-0.004 0.135 0.239 0 -0.1 1.570796</pose>
-      <pose frame="Mailbox::link">.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
+      <pose>1.06 -0.1 0.798 0 0 3.14159</pose>
       <enable>true</enable>
     </plugin>
     <plugin name="alignmentDrillScrew_2" filename="libMisalignmentPlugin.so">
